abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Findings and implications for subsequent
            operation(s) in the series are:  1) In view of the many
            risks the implementation of this program faces, the
            timeframe of future operations should be established with
            care, taking into account possible political obstacles as
            well as capacity constraints in the public service. 2) While
            the provision of formal and informal technical assistance as
            part of the preparation of the first operation has been most
            useful, this may not be possible in future. It would
            therefore be important to ensure that such assistance can be
            provided in other ways, either through a technical
            assistance credit or PHRD grant (Policy and Human Resources
            Development Fund - Japan) or by other donors. Such
            assistance is crucial for the success of the program. 3)
            Future operations might have fewer trigger actions and
            exclude measures that are expected to be taken as part of
            other operations, whether by the International Development
            Association or other donors; 4) There are areas covered by
            the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper, but so far not
            included in the Poverty Reducation Support Credit for
            various reasons. Subsequent operations need to take a fresh
            look at the desirability of including new components in the
            program, notably actions more focused on poverty
            alleviation, taking into account planned activities of other donors.
